page.title: 14Transport, South Buriton
page.content: Only 3 public roads pass the block; A3 London to Portsmouth. There is an unclassified dual carriageway from Buriton to Linchdean which starts as Kiln Lane, busy with dustcarts to the nearby tip. The other roads are mainly single track with passing places.U216 metalled at Buriton pond, then bridleway joins U206. The South Downs Way is metalled to Dean Barn. Bridleway is Coulters Dean. Metalled to Sumwood then leaves South Downs Way for Ditcham. A narrow private metalled road links Ditcham school with U216 and 206, busy at start and close of school. Two rough tracks lead to Downley and Park Barn Cottages. Waterloo to Portsmouth trains pass through via a tunnel. There is no public transport in the area except the Petersfield to Southsea bus route along the A3. Most residents have cars
